intro: Andersonia lehmanniana subsp. lehmanniana, commonly known as the Lehmann's Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its striking, orchid-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dense, tussock-like clumps and has linear, grass-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or seasonally flooded areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
